meanings.sent1: The store precharges customers for online orders to ensure payment upfront.
meanings.sent2: She always precharges her phone before going on a long trip.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel precharges its energy before leaping from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: The athlete precharges their mind with positive thoughts before a big competition.
meanings.sent5: Remember to precharge your laptop before the meeting to avoid any disruptions.

meanings.definition: Charges made before the usual time or rate.
meanings.sent1: The precharges on the bill surprised the customer.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented precharges to cover unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: The precharges on the phone bill were higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: The precharges acted as a safety net for the business during slow months.
meanings.sent5: The precharges on the credit card statement were clearly outlined for the customer.
